cvrfdoc.document_title: Red Hat Security Advisory: pki-core:10.6 security update
cvrfdoc.document_distribution: Copyright Â© 2021 Red Hat, Inc. All rights reserved.

full_product_name.product_name: pki-core:10.6-8030020210315205745.e0223e2d as a component of Red Hat Enterprise Linux AppStream (v. 8)

notes.note: pki-core: Unprivileged users can renew any certificate

reference.description: bz#1914379: CVE-2021-20179 pki-core: Unprivileged users can renew any certificate

remediation.description:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:
https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

acknowledgment.description: Red Hat would like to thank Fraser Tweedale and Geetika Kapoor for reporting this issue.

note:
An update for the pki-core:10.6 module is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.
Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Important. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.

The Public Key Infrastructure (PKI) Core contains fundamental packages required by Red Hat Certificate System.
Security Fix(es):
* pki-core: Unprivileged users can renew any certificate (CVE-2021-20179)
For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
